page.title: 17TOURISM, RHUM
page.content:
Tourists visit Rhum mainly during the summer and at Easter. Some only come for a day trip on The Shearwater which sails from Arisaig. A large cruise ship, The Black Prince, visits Rhum occasionally for the day. Both these types of tourist may go hillwalking or stroll around the village in this short time.
Many of the tourists use the Caledonian MacBrayne ferry, The Lochmor, to get to Rhum. Tourists can stay in the Castle, camp on the shore_side site or stay in a bothy. The Castle offers a choice of standard of accomodation.
Slide shows describing the work carried out on the Reserve are given and ceilidhs are held when sufficient numbers of people are on the island.
